results.title: Treffpunkt Deutschland. Episodes 1-5
results.creator_credit: John Billingham, BBC and John Thomas
results.brief_description: A compilation tape of five programmes designed to help students in their second or third year of learning German. The programmes are built around everyday experiences of some German teenagers and are entirely in German. A simple linking commentary repeats and reinforces the most useful language used. Individual titles indicate content of each program.

results.title: Trees for the wheatlands
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The importance of trees for shade and shelter, beautification, and control of wind erosion in certain areas of the wheatbelt. The Forests Department of Western Australia renders valuable service to farmers and others who desire to plant trees on their properties.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit

results.title: Trees are still growing old, though the ship has been sunk
results.brief_description: One girl’s journey into her quaint dream - her encounter with a giant sheep, jellyfish and cactus and a realisation of how life should be lived.

results.title: Trees and their importance
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of “Basic life science” series
Discusses conservation, explaining the importance of trees as a renewable resource andtheir role in water and soil conservation. Describes the life processes of a tree and how trees contribute to the welfare of humans.

results.title: Trees (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Produced for the Australian National Botanic Gardens, this video explains the functions and uses of trees. It starts with the main parts of a tree, (the roots, leaves and trunk): the processes of photosynthesis, respiration and transpiration and the important part trees play in the water and air cycles, as well as helping to prevent soil erosion. The video then goes on to identify the role trees play in providing food and shelter for the birds and animals, and timber, paper and food for man. The message is clear; Care for trees.

results.title: Tree power
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, James Littleton, Don Hopkins and Judy LeGros
results.brief_description: Over half a million Canadian homes are using wood for heating. With the price of oil escalating, more people are converting to this traditional source of energy. In interviews with home owners and experts, advice is given about building regulations, insurance policies, maintenance procedures, and installation of efficient wood-burning units. The greatest potential for wood is in its combination with oil, gas, or electric back-up heating systems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, James Littleton, Don Hopkins and Judy LeGros

results.title: Tree of wealth
results.brief_description: A survey of the uses to which the coconut is put in South India. No part of either the tree or its fruit is wasted and a living is provided for the entire countryside. Products of the tree include spun fibre; vases; brooms; fuel; choddy; oil and milk.

results.title: Tree of survival
results.creator_credit: United Nations Films and Abdellatif Ben Ammar
results.brief_description: Examines the causes of the spread of the desert in the Sahel region in Niger and shows the migration of the people of the artea to the town. Concentrates on the positive action being taken to enable the people to survive in the rural area such as tree planting.

results.title: Tree business
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Saunders
results.brief_description: A forest survey team is shown working in New Guinea, using modern methods of selecting and evaluating areas for commercial operations. Timber and forest products were always important, and efficient exploitation makes logging a major industry, briefly shown in operation
